intro: Psychotria toviana, commonly known as the Toviana Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish-white flowers. It is often found growing in shaded, humid environments, typically in the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria toviana is also notable for its potential ethnobotanical significance, though its medicinal properties remain under study.
